key_channel_insights.line_content: Approximately 83.83% of OTA prices matched the airline's website, reflecting strong price consistency.
The MSE channel reported an impressive 89.5% of fares lower than the airline website, showcasing its competitive advantage.
Around 93% of GDS offerings were priced higher than the airline's website, indicating significant price inconsistencies.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Approximately 83.83% of the OTA prices matched the airline's website across all dimensions in the last week.
The average last week price difference was only 0.05%, indicating strong alignment in pricing across channels.
In the last month, the OTA channel observed a slight price increase, with 2.33% of the offerings being higher than the airline's own prices.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The OTA channel had 9.19% of offers unavailable compared to the airline website last week.
The 'Same' pricing status remained dominant, particularly strong for last week and previous week comparisons.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul flights show an exceptionally high rate of matching prices, with 83.39% deemed 'Same' for the last week.
Exclusively long-haul routes show that 100% matched the website, yet notable incidences of higher prices were observed.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For offers originating in Switzerland, 88.93% are priced the same as on the airline's website last week.
Non-Swiss point-of-origin flights exhibit a higher percentage of prices that are 'Higher' than the airline's pricing.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries see an 81.11% rate of 'Same' pricing compared to the airline's own offers, indicating stable market pricing.
Far-out bookings exhibit lower consistency, with 0.95% classified as 'Higher' than the airline's pricing last week.

mse_highlights.line_content: In the latest week, 89.5% of fares were lower on the MSE channel compared to the airline's website.
In the last week, there were no instances of prices being higher on the MSE than on the website across all dimensions.
Across short and long haul routes, MSE consistently offers lower prices, particularly noted in the short haul category with 89.4% of fares cheaper.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The MSE channel overwhelmingly offers lower fares, with a vast majority (89.5%) lower than the airline website in the latest week.
Offers that match the airline website remained consistent at approximately 3% in the latest week.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: In the European region, up to 89.6% of fares were lower on MSE, emphasizing the channel's competitiveness in this market.
Data on long haul routes is sparse, but where available, the MSE was lower in price 93.8% of cases.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For fares originating from Switzerland, MSE pricing was lower in 90.3% of cases, reflecting strong local market advantages.
Non-Swiss origins showed similarly competitive rates, maintaining MSE lower pricing in 88.7% of instances.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE offers were lower in price at 88.6% for close-in bookings, while remaining competitive at 91.3% for far out bookings.
Booking window data indicated stable fare conditions, with close-in and far-out bookings reflecting consistent low pricing.

gds_highlights.line_content: Approximately 93% of GDS offerings resulted in higher prices compared to the airlineâ€™s website, indicating a substantial price discrepancy.
Price disparities remained largely consistent over the past month, with GDS prices climbing by approximately 0.43%.
Offers were unavailable on the GDS channel for 7.43% of itineraries analyzed last week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The GDS channel reported that approximately 92.57% of offers were priced higher than the airline's website last week.
No offers matched the website price, highlighting a complete absence of matched pricing in the GDS channel.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Pricing is consistently higher in the GDS channel across all regions, reflecting market-influenced premiums.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For the Non-CH origin, 92.43% of GDS offers were higher than website prices, compared to 92.70% for Swiss offers.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: In close-in booking scenarios, 92.47% of GDS offers were higher compared to web prices.
The far-out booking window exhibited similar trends, with 92.76% of prices being higher than those on the airline's website.
